attributes.additional_details:
All too often, a question will be put to the Prime Minister, only to be totally dodged or ignored.
Very often our Prime Minister will talk about a subject completely un-related to the question posed by a fellow MPs during PMQ's
I want the Speaker of the House to take charge in such matters and guide the Prime Minister into providing an answer befitting the question.
attributes.background: Make it part of the Parliamentary Code to allow the Speaker of the House to force the Prime Minister to answer any question put to him or her, in a full, relevant and meaningful reply.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament as a whole aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Order in the Commons is the responsibility of the Speaker, and Members are responsible for their answers to questions.
